thread.title: North Charleston City 7
thread.title_full: Candidates for North Charleston City Council, District 7 - Post and Courier

author: postandcourier.com
title: North Charleston City 7
text:
Andrea Bailey Erb Andrea Bailey Erb Age: 30
Residence: Singing Pines
Occupation: Oral Pathology Laboratory Supervisor
Education: B.S. In Biology from Lander University; Post-Bach Certificate from MUSC in Histology
 On Facebook at Andrea Bailey Erb for North Charleston City Council District 7 , andreamariebailey@yahoo.com
 Child rearing. I have a 2-year old son.
 Determination and persistance. I may not know the “by the book” route to get matters handled, but I am not afraid to approach people and seek out a resolution.
 Making sure North Charleston’s potential is realized and recognized. We have the ability to make North Charleston the safest and most sought out area to raise a family in, as well as for businesses to prosper in. I would love for North Charleston to reach it’s true potential.
Sam Hart Age: (did not answer)
Residence: 4789 Hasell St.
Occupation: City Councilman and retired educational administrator
Education: Claflin University, BA; Atlanta University, MA
Political experience: North Charleston City Council member and former mayor pro-tem
Contact information: (843) 926-3994
 To be proactive by seeking out problems reflective to constiuents concerns
 Over 100 hours in Leadership Training in Government; graduated from the National League of Cities; presently serves on City Council.
 The recruitment of businesses, improvement of infrastructure, ameliorate conditions between communities and city government.
Corey Van Hannegeyn Age: 39
Residence: Deas Hill
Occupation: Political Consultant
Education: Trident Technical College – Associate of Science
 (843) 817-0612, CoreyDistrict7@gmail.com
 I spend my spare time volunteering and traveling.
 I’m a neighborhood council president, member of the neighborhood council presidents council, past president of the Charleston Trident Urban League YP, business owner and I’ve worked with SC state legislatures.
 My top priority would be to resolve infrastructure issues from traffic congestion to neighborhood sidewalks, street lights, speed bumps and drainage.
